Hi, I’m submitting to *Journal of Computational Biology* and they require the entire manuscript to be written in present tense. Here’s my draft (plain text). Please review it and fix any tense inconsistencies.

Title: Deep Learning for Protein‑Protein Interaction Prediction
Authors: Alice Smith, Bob Lee

Abstract
We developed a convolutional neural network that was able to predict interactions. The model achieved high accuracy.

Introduction
In this study, we investigated the performance of deep learning methods. We collected a dataset of interactions and then trained several models.

Methods
Data were gathered from public repositories. The network was trained for 100 epochs.

Results
Our experiments showed that the approach outperformed traditional methods. The accuracy was 92%.

Discussion
The results indicated that deep learning can significantly improve prediction quality. Future work will explore larger datasets.

| Section | Line | Original Text | Suggested Revision |

| Abstract | 6 | The model achieved high accuracy. | **The model achieves** high accuracy. |
| Introduction | 9 | In this study, we investigated the performance of deep learning methods. | **In this study, we investigate** the performance of deep learning methods. |
| Introduction | 10 | We collected a dataset of interactions and then trained several models. | **We collect** a dataset of interactions and then **train** several models. |
| Methods | 13 | Data were gathered from public repositories. | **Data are** gathered from public repositories. |
| Methods | 14 | The network was trained for 100 epochs. | **The network is** trained for 100 epochs. |

| Results | 18 | The accuracy was 92%. | **The accuracy is** 92%. |
| Discussion | 21 | The results indicated that deep learning can significantly improve prediction quality. | **The results indicate** that deep learning can significantly improve prediction quality. |
